docs.snippet: Many Times readers thought President Trump made the right response to the Syrian government’s chemical attack. Others questioned his motivation.

headline.print_headline: ‘Mr. President, Syria Needs Our Help’: Times Readers React to Missile Strike
headline.main: ‘Mr. President, Syria Needs Our Help’: Times Readers React to Missile Strike

docs.snippet: The three Americans now detained in North Korea are being held at a time of heightened tensions with the West.

headline.print_headline: Imprisoned in North Korea in Tense Times: The Stories of 3 Americans
headline.main: Imprisoned in North Korea: The Cases of 3 Americans

docs.snippet: Love isn’t always black and white, and the photographer Andre Wagner shows the range of the emotion through his gray-scale images.
President Michel Temer has grown so unpopular that some in Brazil believe the coach of the national soccer team, or a clown named Grumpy, would be better choices.

headline.print_headline: Their Government in Chaos, Brazilians Fear the Joke Is on Them
headline.main: Their Government in Chaos, Brazilians Fear the Joke Is on Them

docs.snippet: The spirit’s new popularity in the United States thrills many Americans but worries others, who fear for its sustainability.

headline.print_headline: Here, Try Some Mezcal. But Not Too Much.
headline.main: Here, Try Some Mezcal. But Not Too Much.

docs.snippet: John Shields’s decision to end his life was heartbreaking. Meet two others who weighed a medically assisted death.
Friday: Gay fatherhood, weekend events, and touring our city’s L.G.B.T. history.

headline.main: New York Today: Two Men and a Baby

docs.snippet: Friday: A Los Angeles landmark struggles to survive, Mark Zuckerberg’s great American road trip, and the Golden Gate Bridge turns 80.

headline.main: California Today: Rising Rent Threatens a Los Angeles Treasure

docs.snippet: Facial recognition and other technology are set to further personalize the driving experience.

headline.print_headline: Your Car May Soon Be Able to Read Your Face
headline.main: Soon, Your Car May Be Able to Read Your Expressions

docs.snippet: The violinist Augustin Hadelich's virtuosic performance of Dvorak, and surprise in "Carmen" and Franz Schmidt's Symphony No. 2 were among the highlights.
